section.name: Software installation, accounting settings, chart of accounts, started capital.

body.section:
Keywords: free and open-source double-entry accounting software.
* the easiest way to install and try Beigesoft™ EIS is installing it on an Android device, because of you don't need to install the Java and the crypto-provider in this case, see Beigesoft™ EIS for Android.
Bob Brown from NY decided to start his own pizza business as sole proprietor. Bob's Pizza makes frozen pizza, so according NYS. sales taxable food he isn't a sales tax vendor. Bob read IRS 583 Starting a business and elected:
calendar tax year
account Inventory to calculate costs that decrease his income tax, so he has to use accrual accounting method.
FIFO method for pizza ingredients whose cost can't be recognized (e.g. eggs) according IRS Accounting Periods and Methods
Bob chose Beigesoft™ EIS because it's free, it does everything that he needs, it's easy to install and use. In addition it works as standalone WEB application on a notebook and on an Android tablet with the same SQLite database. Bob can send database from his notebook to his tablet and vise versa. In the future (when it's needs) Bob can publish his software on cloud, Beigesoft™ EIS is ready for high load job. You are able to transfer full data from any EIS's SQlite database into high load (enterprise ready) MySql or PostgreSql database by using WEB-service (see Import an EIS database by using WEB-service).
Bob installed Java (Oracle) and Google Chrome on his notebook (Chromium or Opera will do too). Bob downloaded a file beige-accjet-bin.zip from central Maven repository https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Cg%3A%22org.beigesoft%22 or https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/beigesoft/beige-accjet/. He extracted the ZIP archive then launched the JAR file beige-accjet-jar-with-dependencies.jar by double click on it or right click and choose Java. You can start any executable JAR from command line (synonyms - "terminal", "command prompt", "power shell") by type command: java -jar beige-accjet-jar-with-dependencies.jar
Bob should see window like this:
Beigesoft™ EIS standalone versions are always in secure enabled mode, that is they use encrypted (HTTPS) connection and require strong password for authorization, they also use encryption (modern algorithm RSA with 2048bit key and 256bit AES) for safe file (SQlite databases) exchange between computers/tablets. So you should think of strong password. Think also of A-Jetty number (it should be different from A-Jetty on another computer/tablet).
* it seems to be useless to encrypt HTTP traffic and files that are used inside only computer (because of all application on computer has direct access to the EIS SQLite databases), but you are able to run standalone (non-cloud) EIS in "protected from light harmful software mode" (see below).
To make strong and ease to remember password, you should use 2-3 words and several (3-5) digits, e.g. "racooneatstone123"
Bob entered new A-Jetty number, new password, confirmed it, then he pushed button Start. If you got error (see title):
then see starter.log file in application folder.
a) If it's saying:
...org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException: unable to create OutputEncryptor: JCE cannot authenticate the provider BC...
then you should install Bouncy Castle crypto-provider in static way:
download bcprov-jdk15on-1.59.jar from https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/bouncycastle/bcprov-jdk15on/1.59/ and bcpkix-jdk15on-1.59.jar from https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/bouncycastle/bcpkix-jdk15on/1.59/
put them into [java-home]/lib/ext e.g. "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre[version#8]\lib\ext" (change [version#8] to yours)
Previous step usually is sufficient, otherwise you should also add Bouncy Castle into java.security. Add entry "security.provider.[next_number]=org.bouncycastle.jce.provider.BouncyCastleProvider" into [JAVA_HOME]/lib/security/java.security. On MS Windows copy java.security to your documents folder, edit it then copy back into "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre[version#8]\lib\security".
This is part of java.security for example:
... security.provider.8=org.jcp.xml.dsig.internal.dom.XMLDSigRI security.provider.9=sun.security.smartcardio.SunPCSC security.provider.10=sun.security.mscapi.SunMSCAPI security.provider.11=org.bouncycastle.jce.provider.BouncyCastleProvider ...
* the latest JRE usually doesn't require next step (starting problem resolving). b) If starter.log is saying:
...org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException: unable to create OutputEncryptor: Illegal key size or default parameters...
then you should install "Java Cryptography Extension (JCE) Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files for Java 8" into folder [JAVA_HOME]/lib/security. For MS Windows you can find these files in folder "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre[version#8]\lib\security\policy\unlimited", otherwise download these from Oracle HTTPS web-site. Encryption with strong keys (long size) protects you (your information) from swindlers, so any law must protects you too.
After A-Jetty has been successfully started (it may takes several minutes for the first time to create database) button with HTTPS address has been appeared:
A-Jetty Certificate Authority certificate ajetty-ca.pem will be at the application folder. You can install it as trusted Certificate Authority in the browser, otherwise your browser will scare you "your connection is not private ...". This is not true, your connection (https) is encrypted, and no application can read traffic (your data). The only true is A-Jetty HTTPS is signed by unknown certificate authority (CA). So after installing CA A-Jetty (ajetty-ca.pem), browsers stop show fearful messages. But you can point browser to accept this site without installing CA certificate - just push "Advanced" then "Proceed to localhost (unsafe)", and browser will show only little scaring sign "red https". In this case (without installing CA certificate) the red https sign will be only problem, connection will be encrypted well, so software, that can intercept traffic locally (intercept port) e.g. an anti-virus, can't read your data (decrypt traffic).
Unencrypted HTTP is actually danger thing for you, and browsers never scare you about it. It's not only about your data reading/changing/tracking, also, any HTML page comes to your browser by passing through several Internet servers, and if some server is affected by harmful software, then it can inject harmful script (software) in the page.
To install A-Jetty CA certificate on chrome push Menu -> Settings -> Advanced -> Manage certificates -> AUTHORITIES and push button IMPORT, here is Linux example:
On MS Windows switch file extension to all "*.*" in order to select "*.pem" file, and you can not constraint CA usage to "Only for HTTPS verification". Certificates that aren't signed by global trusted CA are often used to create private (non-public internet) intranets and for using digital signatures inside organization (business entity). Here "home-made" A-Jetty CA is used to create HTTPS intranet inside only computer and for safe file exchange between your computers/tablets.
Here are part of screenshots will be shown with installed A-Jetty CA certificate (the https sign is well), and part without it (https is red).
After installing certificate ajetty-ca.pem on web-browser, Bob pushed button https://localhost:8443/bsa8443 - default browser will opened this address. At first time empty database requires to add the first (only) user with strong password, so Bob added himself:
At first Bob changed organization name in accounting settings, he selected Menu -> Appearance - > Standard -> Accounting -> Accounting settings:
Bob changed report page settings: page size to "Letter", in this case unit of measurement is INCH, font size 3.5mm=0.1378inch. For page size A2-5 use millimeters. Bob agreed all other settings include cost precision 4 decimal places to reduce rounding error. Setting Current accounting year used for restricting year in new document or accounting entry.
Chart of accounts.
Bob changed names of two accounts "started capital" and "retained earnings" and "is used" for his needs. Property "is used" means that whether account will presents in picker and in reports. Using subaccounts is simple and efficient way to manage your chart of accounts. Bob added subaccounts taxes, properties, bank accounts, etc. Expenses screenshot:
Then add them into accounts, for example Employment Taxes Payable account:
Finally, chart of accounts is:

Started capital.
Bob opened checking account #1236786b17 in Bank on Jan 10 2016 and deposited 40000USD. He made the first accounting entries from Menu Accounting -> Input accounting Entries:
* amount in accounting entries always has maximum decimal places - 4 for cost precision.
Book's style entries vs Computer's style ones
Accounting entries above is made with computer's style - two classic symmetric entries are made as a single one:
Debit "Cash In Bank.#1236786b17 in Bank" Credit "Bob's Started Capital" for 40,000.00 USD
Classic accounting book entries are equivalent to above one:
Debit Credit "Cash In Bank.#1236786b17 in Bank" 40,000.00 USD "Bob's Started Capital" 40,000.00 USD
Main tips to use Beigesoft™ EIS.
* here "Entity" means any element like "Expense", "Account", document, etc.
If you are editing a form but forget to create a dependent entity, e.g. Employee for document Wage, then you can open Beigesoft™ EIS in another browser tab and create Employee, then go back and in picker press page (1 for example) to refresh it.
You can edit accounting entry' description(only) in menu Accounting - Accounting Records
Part of entities require entering ID manually for their creating. For customer/vendor/employee ID you can use its phone number (only numbers) or tax identification number. If you got error when you are creating such entity, then probably ID is not unique, e.g. ID for "Other fees" is already in use:
Running Beigesoft™ EIS in "protected from light harmful software" mode.
Light harmful software hide inside a regular application (not inside an operation system file), or it is any harmful-script, e.g script on HTML page. Light harmful software run under your regular account, and it can read any file that you can read. On *nix OS (Linux...) you can run Beige Accounting under another account in terminal. To do this:
Open terminal and login as ROOT user - command "su", set current directory to "cd /home".
As ROOT add new user "accountant" with password - commands "useradd -m -U accountant", "passwd accountant" and "chmod o-r accountant"
Add shared folder for file exchange: "mkdir /file-exch" and "chmod o+w /file-exch"
Install file manager Midnight Commandor (mc)
Exit from ROOT - "exit"
Copy beige-accjet-bin.zip into /file-exch by using any file manager
Open terminal and login as accountant - "su -l accountant"
Use file manager Midnight mc to install (unpack) Beige Accounting
Screenshots:
On Ubuntu Linux and Mac OS account root is disabled, and your regular account is able to invoke sudo command, so do that above (only root part) as:
$ cd /home $ sudo useradd -m -U accountant $ sudo passwd accountant $ sudo chmod o-r accountant $ sudo mkdir /file-exch $ sudo chmod o+w /file-exch
To start Beige Accounting in "command line mode" run: "java -jar beige-accjet-jar-with-dependencies.jar cli":
As a result you (and possible light harmful software, e.g. if your web-browser has enabled macros on HTML page to read your file system) can't read "accountant" files:
Light harmful software can try to match your password and steal your data by making HTTP requests. But you are protected with strong password and maximum 5 fail login attempts per session:
you should check secure.log periodically:
Heavy harmful software poison your operation system, so it can do everything. OS updates might remove it, but complex harmware can fake "OS updates", so you have only way to heal your computer - completely reinstall OS by using clean, write-protected installation source (DVD).
